definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: Procedures and processes, in the next track slowly chewing.
sentences.chinese: 程序与过程，在往后的行迹中慢慢咀嚼。

sentences.english: He has been hiding his whereabouts very well.
sentences.chinese: 他一直将自己的行迹掩藏得很好。

sentences.english: A suspicious boat made up to us.
sentences.chinese: 一艘行迹可疑的船向我们驶来。

sentences.english: Preaching of self-contempt, eternalised in guilt. In words and deed, a man's high treason.
sentences.chinese: 这自卑的辩辞，不朽的罪悔，他那叛弃的言语和行迹。

definition: to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
to hide/to conceal and avoid (contact)/to keep sth concealed
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
eyes and ears/sb's attention or notice/information/knowledge/spies
to hide/to go into hiding/to take refuge
